intro: Lachnaea laevigata, commonly known as the smooth lachnaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit. Lachnaea laevigata is primarily known for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing sandy habitats.
